title: How to cite
text: Always cite original data providers using data. required data licenses (CC-), also essential practice research. PRIOGRID package makes citation easy. dataset includes PRIOGRID variables haven’t renamed, simply use pgcitations() function retrieve appropriate citations data sources dataset. maintaining original variable names using function, ensure proper attribution data providers whose work contributes research. can also just get biblatex entries using pgcitations(variables, as_biblatex = T).
code: variables <- c("hilde_urban", "cru_tmp") pgcitations(variables) ## ## Package Citation ##  ## Tollefsen AF, Strand H, Buhaug H (2012). "PRIO-GRID: A Unified Spatial ## Data Structure." _Journal of Peace Research_, *49*(2), 363-374. ## doi:10.1177/0022343311431287 ## <https://doi.org/10.1177/0022343311431287>. ##  ## Vestby J, Tollefsen AF, Helskog K, Benz G (2025). _priogrid: the ## R-package_. R package version 0.0.0.9000, ## <http://prio-data.github.io/priogrid>. ##  ##  ## Additionally, please cite these data providers: ## (based on these variables: cru_tmp ) ## [1] I. Harris, T. J. Osborn, P. Jones, et al. "Version 4 of the CRU TS ## Monthly High-Resolution Gridded Multivariate Climate Dataset". In: ## _Scientific Data_ 7.1 (Apr. 2020), p. 109. ISSN: 2052-4463. DOI: ## 10.1038/s41597-020-0453-3.

title: PRIO-GRID Replication Code
text: PRIOGRID depends several spatial libraries (terra, sf, exactextractr) require system-level geo-libraries. installation fails, please refer installation guides dependencies: terra installation guide sf installation guide exactextractr installation guide continue experience issues following guides, please file issue.

title: PRIO-GRID Replication Code
text: PRIOGRID stores settings locally persist across R sessions. using package, configure PRIOGRID store downloaded raw data transformed datasets:
code: # Set the folder for PRIOGRID data storage pgoptions$set_rawfolder("/path/to/your/data/folder")  # Configure temporal settings (optional) pgoptions$set_start_date(as.Date("1990-12-31")) pgoptions$set_end_date(as.Date("2023-12-31"))  # View your configuration pg_dates() pg_date_intervals() prio_blank_grid()

title: PRIO-GRID Replication Code
text: Spatial resolution: 0.5×0.5 degrees Projection: EPSG:4326 (WGS84) Temporal resolution: 1 year Temporal extent: 1850 present (data exists) Note: setting dates, use last day desired temporal increment. example, use 1850-12-31 yearly data instead 1850-01-01.

title: PRIO-GRID Replication Code
text: simplest workflow involves downloading complete PRIOGRID dataset reading R:
code: # Download the latest PRIOGRID dataset to your local folder download_priogrid()  # Read the dataset into memory df <- read_priogrid()  # Explore the data View(df)

title: PRIO-GRID Replication Code
text: Always cite original data providers. data licenses require attribution (e.g., CC-), proper citation fundamental good research practice. using PRIOGRID data original variable names, retrieve necessary citations :

text: users need transform data custom specifications work original source data:
code: # View available data sources View(pgsources)  # List all downloadable files files_to_download <- pg_rawfiles()  # Download specific sources ucdp_files <- pg_rawfiles() |>    dplyr::filter(source_name == "UCDP GED") download_pg_rawdata(file_info = ucdp_files)

title: PRIO-GRID Replication Code
text: data source dedicated functions reading transformation. Large files use memory-efficient processing via terra: Source-specific transformation functions documented corresponding R/data_[source].R files.
code: # Read population data r <- read_ghsl_population_grid()  # Calculate travel time with custom aggregation ttime_max <- calc_traveltime(aggregation_function = "max")

title: PRIO-GRID Replication Code
text: PRIOGRID supports flexible spatial temporal configurations:

previous_headings: Advanced Usage > Customizing Spatial and Temporal Resolution
title: PRIO-GRID Replication Code
code: # Monthly data pgoptions$set_start_date(as.Date("2022-12-31")) pgoptions$set_temporal_resolution("1 month") r_monthly <- gen_cru_tmp()  # Quarterly data pgoptions$set_temporal_resolution("1 quarter") r_quarterly <- gen_cru_tmp()

previous_headings: Advanced Usage > Customizing Spatial and Temporal Resolution
title: PRIO-GRID Replication Code
text: Important: changing spatial resolution, extent, projection, PRIOGRID IDs differ default configuration. custom IDs used within datasets sharing spatial configuration.
code: # Lower resolution with custom extent pgoptions$set_ncol(36) pgoptions$set_nrow(18) pgoptions$set_extent(c("xmin" = 0, "xmax" = 180, "ymin" =  0, "ymax" = 90)) r_low_res <- gen_cru_tmp() plot(r_low_res)  # Compare different resolutions pgoptions$set_ncol(360) pgoptions$set_nrow(180) pgoptions$set_extent(c("xmin" = -180, "xmax" = 180, "ymin" =  -90, "ymax" = 90)) plot(prio_blank_grid())  # High resolution  pgoptions$set_ncol(36) pgoptions$set_nrow(18) plot(prio_blank_grid())  # Low resolution

what: Extract Land Cover Proportions from HILDA+ Data for PRIO-GRID Cells — hilda_landcover
title: Extract Land Cover Proportions from HILDA+ Data for PRIO-GRID Cells — hilda_landcover
text: Calculates proportion PRIO-GRID cell covered specific land cover type using HILDA+ global land use/land cover data. function performs spatial aggregation high-resolution HILDA+ rasters (1km) PRIO-GRID cells (see pgoptions), accounting partial coverage using area-weighted averaging.

title: Extract Land Cover Proportions from HILDA+ Data for PRIO-GRID Cells — hilda_landcover
Extract Land Cover Proportions from HILDA+ Data for PRIO-GRID Cells — hilda_landcover
text: landcovertype Numeric. land cover class identifier extract HILDA+ data. Must valid land cover code according HILDA+ classification scheme (see Details common codes). HILDA+ land cover class codes (stable categories): 00: Ocean 11: Urban 22: Cropland 33: Pasture/rangeland 44: Forest 55: Unmanaged grass/shrubland 66: Sparse/vegetation 77: Water 99: data

title: Extract Land Cover Proportions from HILDA+ Data for PRIO-GRID Cells — hilda_landcover
text: SpatRaster object (terra package) structure PRIO-GRID, cell contains proportion (0-1) cell covered specified land cover type. raster contains: Values: Proportions ranging 0 (coverage) 1 (full coverage) Layers: One layer per year matching HILDA+ PRIO-GRID temporal coverage Layer names: Dates YYYY-MM-DD format

title: PRIO-GRID Meta-data survey and source information — pgsources
PRIO-GRID Meta-data survey and source information — pgsources
text: data frame 37 rows 18 columns: id Unique Universal Identifier (UUID) source_name Required: Full name source, preferably including institution hosting . source_version Required: version data source, noted creator. none, use publication year. license Required: data license. nothing stated, "rights reserved". Use URL licenses specific owner. citation_keys Required: bibkey(s) citation. use Zotero Better Bibtex organize citations. Separate semi-colon one. aws_bucket Amazon S3 bucket data repository. Use source uses Amazon S3. aws_region Amazon S3 region data repository. Use source uses Amazon S3. download_url URL data-file. multiple, use file data/urls/{id}.txt URL per line. website_url Required: URL relevant online landing site data. tags Comma-separated tags used sort navigate data sources. spatial_extent Required: World, Multiple continents, Single continent, Several countries (spread). currently including single country data. temporal_resolution Required: Static, Higher monthly, Monthly, Quarterly, Yearly, Less yearly. reference_keys Bibkey(s) relevant references, e.g., articles discussing older versions, articles using data, articles testing data. Separate semi-colon. prio_mirror URL path data/urls/{id}_mirror.txt. Alternative download location hosted PRIO. download_url_exists Boolean, test whether supplied url worked. regularly test urls. website_url_exists Boolean, test whether supplied url worked. regularly test urls. prio_mirror_exists Boolean, test whether supplied url worked. regularly test urls. created_at date stamp entry last updated.

what: Read and Process CRU TS Near Surface Temperature Data — read_cru_tmp
title: Read and Process CRU TS Near Surface Temperature Data — read_cru_tmp
text: function reads CRU TS (Climate Research Unit Time Series) v4.09 near surface temperature climate data files local storage, unzips necessary, loads raster stacks, filters data match PRIO-GRID temporal coverage. function also support reading supporting statistics.

title: Read and Process CRU TS Near Surface Temperature Data — read_cru_tmp
Read and Process CRU TS Near Surface Temperature Data — read_cru_tmp
text: variable character string specifying climate variable extract raster stack. Must match prefix variable names CRU dataset. Available options include "tmp" (temperature), "stn" (station count), "mae" (mean absolute error), "maea". Default "tmp".

title: Read and Process CRU TS Near Surface Temperature Data — read_cru_tmp
text: SpatRaster object (terra package) following characteristics: Spatial Resolution: 0.5° x 0.5° global grid Spatial Extent: Global coverage (-180° 180° longitude, -90° 90° latitude) Coordinate System: WGS84 geographic (lon/lat) Temporal Coverage: Filtered match PRIO-GRID date intervals Layer Names: Set corresponding timestamps Units: Variable-specific (e.g., degrees Celsius temperature)

title: Read and Process CRU TS Near Surface Temperature Data — read_cru_tmp
text: Harris , Osborn TJ, Jones P, Lister D (2020). “Version 4 CRU TS Monthly High-Resolution Gridded Multivariate Climate Dataset.” Scientific Data, 7(1), 109. ISSN 2052-4463, doi:10.1038/s41597-020-0453-3 .

title: Read and Process CRU TS Near Surface Temperature Data — read_cru_tmp

title: Reads the HILDA+ data — read_hilda
text: Downloads processes HILDA+ (Historic Land Dynamics Assessment) global land use land cover change data, filtering years compatible PRIO-GRID temporal coverage. function returns multi-layer raster annual land use/land cover states.

title: Reads the HILDA+ data — read_hilda
Reads the HILDA+ data — read_hilda
text: SpatRaster object (terra package) containing annual land use/land cover states. layer represents one year, layer names formatted dates (YYYY-MM-DD). raster : Spatial resolution: 0.01 degrees (approximately 1 km) Coordinate reference system: WGS84 (EPSG:4326) Global extent: -180 180° longitude, -90 90° latitude Temporal coverage: Years matching PRIO-GRID dates (max 1899-2019) function depends internal get_pgfile, zip_file, pg_dates functions priogrid package. object class sf

title: Reads the HILDA+ data — read_hilda
text: HILDA+ provides global land use land cover change data 1 km spatial resolution 1960 2019. function: Extracts downloaded raster files containing annual land use/land cover states Filters years match PRIO-GRID temporal coverage Creates multi-layer SpatRaster standardized date names land use/land cover classes HILDA+ include various categories : cropland, pasture, urban areas, forests, natural land covers. pixel value represents specific land use/land cover class according HILDA+ classification scheme.

title: Reads the HILDA+ data — read_hilda

title: Robustly transform any raster to PRIO-GRID format — robust_transformation
text: function performs comprehensive transformation input rasters match PRIO-GRID specification. handles rasters different projections, extents, resolutions intelligent workflow includes reprojection, cropping, aggregation, disaggregation, final resampling needed.

title: Robustly transform any raster to PRIO-GRID format — robust_transformation
Robustly transform any raster to PRIO-GRID format — robust_transformation
text: r SpatRaster object transform. Can projection, extent, resolution. agg_fun Character string function aggregating high-resolution data. Common options include "mean", "sum", "max", "min", "median", "modal". See aggregate options. disagg_method Character string specifying disaggregation method low-resolution data. Options "near" (nearest neighbor, default), "bilinear", "cubic". See disagg details. ... Additional arguments passed aggregate. Useful controlling aggregation behavior (e.g., na.rm = TRUE). cores Integer specifying number CPU cores use aggregation operations. Defaults 1. Higher values can speed processing large datasets.

title: Robustly transform any raster to PRIO-GRID format — robust_transformation
text: SpatRaster object conforming PRIO-GRID specifications: CRS: specified global options (default: EPSG:4326) Extent: specified global options (default: global extent) Resolution: Calculated nrow/ncol global options Grid alignment: Exactly matched PRIO-GRID cell boundaries

title: Robustly transform any raster to PRIO-GRID format — robust_transformation
text: transformation workflow automatically detects handles: Projection differences: Reprojects PRIO-GRID CRS needed Extent mismatches: Crops input larger PRIO-GRID extent Resolution differences: Aggregates high-resolution data using specified aggregation function Disaggregates low-resolution data using specified method Final alignment: Uses nearest-neighbor resampling exact grid matching intermediate files written temporary storage handle large datasets efficiently automatically cleaned processing.

title: Robustly transform any raster to PRIO-GRID format — robust_transformation
text: large datasets, consider: Increasing cores parameter faster aggregation Ensuring adequate disk space raw data folder temporary files Pre-cropping input data region interest transformation

title: Robustly transform any raster to PRIO-GRID format — robust_transformation
text: function uses global PRIO-GRID options set via PGOptionsManager: pgoptions$get_rawfolder(): Location temporary file storage pgoptions$get_ncol(), pgoptions$get_nrow(): Output grid dimensions pgoptions$get_extent(): Output spatial extent pgoptions$get_crs(): Output coordinate reference system
